titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Book Trade Collection
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:52

did.unittitle: Book trade collection

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Receipts and short notes concerning the book trade in London in the late 18th and early 19th centuries. Booksellers include Thomas Caddell, Thomas Longman, Thomas Lowndes, George Nicol, John Nourse, Paul Vaillant, Thomas Vernor, John Whiston, and John Wilkie. There is one long letter from Andrew Millar to David Mallet about the sales of Mallet's edition of the works of Henry St. John, Lord Viscount Bolingbroke.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Book Trade Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Book Trade Collection. The James Marshall and Marie-Louise Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid was produced from a previously existing card set in the Manuscripts Catalog, or from another inventory. All pertinent bibliographical information has been retained. If the collection also contains unlisted or unsorted material, this has been noted in the box-and-folder list.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This finding aid encompasses accessions of materials pertaining to the book trade.
